Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: Hi ladies, I now have offical LE. This SUCKS. I have had minor swells here and there over the last almost 2 years but I had had more swelling this last month so I finally went and saw my LE Therapist. Oh yes....spots on my arm are 1-2 inches bigger than my last measurements in October 2011.  So she did the wrap on Wednesday and I went back on Friday and it did go down but not as much as she wanted it to. So we did a different kind of wrap. It was actually painful so I took off all the bandages and it was huge. My hand I can hardly make a fist it is so swollen. So I wore my sleeve for a while let the swelling go down a little. and re-wrapped. I am so depressed. I just want to cry. How can this happen to me. SHIT. I have a 2 1/2 year old son, I work 50+ hours a week and I type all day. Typing with this freaking thing on my arm is super hard to work....I swear if I didnt have my son I would not have any will to live...I just honestly feel like that sometimes. I am glad I can come here and vent...thank you. You gals were so helpful when I had my cellulitis last summer. I knew you all would understand. I want this gone. I see my LE therapist every other day..or that is what we have scheduled for the next 2 weeks. I have been doing my LMD and breathing, opening my neck node and stomach with the breathing. Ok I am done complaining. Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My LE---sigh allisontom911 Binney4

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I am still very confused by the information given to me by my onc. He said yesterday he wants a PET to confirm the exact nodes in my mediastinum that are metastic. The CT Scan results showed - "multiple nodules  consistant with adenopathy in the anterior mediastinum and right paratracheal mediastinum" Under the impression it says - metastatic adenopathy in the mediastinum. New from prior study. I asked him what stage does this make me and he said late IIIC or early IV. I said early IV, really I thought stage IV was stage IV. He said well lets just wait and see what the PET says. I will start treatment on Monday June 4th. He will not say for sure what chemo I am getting until we have the PET results. When we talked after knowing the axilla nodules were all cancer he said A/C then Herceptin. Now he said Taxol and Herceptin. Isnt Taxol kind of a mild chemo? I want to put everything into this. I asked him about Tykerb and or doing the T-DM1. He said he will look into the clinicals to see if I qualify for anything. Sorry to bug you all again. I just want to start treatment. I have been getting tests and doctor appts for a month now with this stupid cancer running around my body. Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Getting PET scan now - Stage IV? allisontom911 bhd1

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: Hi gals, yes me again. I have active cancer again and my arm is so huge. I havent done my flexitouch in about 10 days. I havent worn any compression either. I was thinking that I can not do anything while this is in my nodes? PET scan and neck biopsy confirmed nodes in my neck and mediastinium again. When is is safe to do treatment again? I should start new chemo this week Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: remind me when I can do treatments when cancer is active allisontom911 kira

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I am sure there are several threads out there but I can never seem to find what I am looking for. I had my first A/C on Monday 6/4. I was nausiated by an hour after treatment. I had aloxi, decadron, Emend. I was so sick. I did not fill or take the decadron cuz I hate the wired feeling it gives. I know that can help the Emend but uggg. So I take my compazine and Zofran and still do not feel good. Then the bone aches. My legs feel like they are going to fall off. I did get sick this morning. Could of been my empty stomache after working out. Chemo nurse said my hair will probably fall out sooner this time than with TCH. Mine fell out on day 19 before. Got to see my PET scan yesterday. Looks like the cancer is in my muscle tissue, all over my shoulder/arm nodes. I think I counted 8 or more. The report just said several clusters. The mediastinal lymphnodes anterior and paratracheal and of course axilla nodes. Thanks for any tips....is the decadron really necessary?? Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A/C Chemo - any tips? allisontom911 banjobanjo

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: Hi Everyone, I am having a heck of a time with my LE. We know it isnt cancer since my recenet scan came back clear!!!! My therapist thinks it is may chemo making things flare up, she said she has seen that in a few patients. I have no cuts, no infection, MLD is not working and Lebed is not working. We did a pump 2x last week and my hand/arm was better right after but then came back the next day or so. My hand is so swollen I can almost not make a fist. So she submitted for a flexi touch and this wednesday the rep from flexitouch is meeting me to show me how it works and see what I think. She said she is pretty sure my insurance will ok it. Especially since this is goign to be an ongoing thing and i am so young. I hope insurance approves it!!!!! Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Might be getting flexitouch! allisontom911 purple32

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I did go and see the other therapist and she agreed my current LE therapist is doing everything she should be. She was great, super sweet and we did some different measuring but all in all, no need to drive 40minutes oneway to see her. I did have her feel a lump I found on the outskirts of the axilla area. She said call your onc to be safe. So that started a roller coaster of events. i found another lump, saw onc, he wants them removed. And yes they are on my LE side. Saw the surgeon last Tuesday and he agreed, need to remove them. We actually found another noduel so total of 3. He said he isnt worried to much about the one on the outside of the axilla but the 2 in the axilla area are worrisome but he did say they are a little hard to be lymph nodes. He is a very skilled surgeon and aware of LE and I have all my tools to try and keep things under control. Just need some prayers that this is just scare tissue from my radiation. I am still awake at 1230am and my alarm is going off at 445. I have cleaned, organized, paid bills and did my nails. Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: having surgery tomorrow allisontom911 Momine

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I just had my 2nd treatment of Kadcyla on Monday the 29th. From the 1st-2nd treatment I could feel the node in my neck get smaller which was great. Now it has doubled in size since last Monday. I have also lost my voice again. I loose it every couple of months. I am going to call the onc tomorrow but my fear is that Kadcyla isnt working. This neck node is really big. You can see it. Maybe it is an infection and that is why I have lost my voice? Any thoughts?? thanks gals! Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question - neck lymph node allisontom911 Inky

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I do not post often. Mostly read. When I was diagnosed last May with my Stage IV or as some oncologist would say Stage IIIC I was devestated. I did AC DD for 4 treatments and then 20 weeks of Taxol plus Herceptin and I am still on Herceptin. I went to the dr today because my neck is so swollen. We thought it may be a blod clot since it is on my port side. Ultrasound of the neck said no clot, definatley a lymphnode. CT scan showed that in my neck plus it did get a few lymphnodes in the mediastinal area which is where it was last year. This is showing up on a side I have never had cancer. My cancer has always been on my right side. So they cant get me in for a PET until Tuesday along with a biopsy.I would imagine to make sure it is still breast cancer and still ER/PR - and HER2+ So what treatment options are there after Herceptin stops working? What chemo is next. I did Taxotere/carbo and Herceptin the 1st time and then last year the AC and Taxol plus Herceptin. Please give me some treatment optinons that you guys have done. Please say a prayer for me. I have a 3 1/2 year old that I need to be here for. Allison Dx 12/8/2009, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 12/21/2009 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 12/21/2009 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/10/2010 Mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 6/15/2010 Surgery 12/28/2010 Prophylactic mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Dx 5/17/2012, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 6/4/2012 AC Targeted Therapy 7/30/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/30/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 7/2/2013, IDC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 9/23/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 2/18/2014 AC Chemotherapy 4/15/2014 Gemzar (gemcitabine) Chemotherapy 6/24/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ladies I need help...talk me off the ledge allisontom911 Moiralf

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: Hi Ladies, I am looking to see what some of you have done about doing a mx. I wont be having surgery until May once I am done with chemo. I do know from my MRI and PET that the tumor in my breast is 4.8cm and the tumor in my axillary node is 6cm, biopsy said both the same cancer.  I also had a lymph node up by my collar bone positive too from the PET scan. I will have radiation after surgery. I know I can not do implants due to the radiation says the PS. Just looking for comments from others that are Stage 3. Thanks everyone. Posts.Title: Cant decide between single or double mx allisontom911 pupfoster1

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: Hi gals, still trying to get ahold of my LE. Go again tomorrow for therapy. I did go and get a couple of the maidenform "control it" tanks. it keeps rolling up on me. It fits the upper part of me good, i had gotten it to big to begin with. what does everyone else wear? My LE therapist is going to measure me for a custom night garment along with a vest that will velcro so as I lose more weight we can adjust it. Thanks everyone! Posts.Title: compression tank? allisontom911 snorfia

Posts.Content: allisontom911 wrote: I have been fine, did a treatment this morning with my flexitouch went up and took a shower and now my entire lower arm is bright red and so painful. Pain is in my entire arm.  I an swelling worse too. Can hardly close my hand. I feel ok right now. I have had cellulitis before but it started off small. Not like this. It isnt as red now but still red. I was just in the hospital for a staph infection in February and lost both my implants. I dont want to be in the hospital again.
